page.title: 01Western Part of Peterculter.
page.content: This is a rural area, only one cormner (part of Peterculter) being urban. In that corner was a centuries - old paper mill which was the start of the village. The mill closed 5 years ago, and the site is being turned to private housing. Next to the road bridge is a wooden statue of Rob Roy, and opposite, the war memorial. Within the block lie a roman marching-camp, covered by forestry, and the ancient ruined Kirk of Dalmalk on its beautiful riverside site. The old line of the railway to Ballater passes through the block as do the main roads north and south of the river. Since 1975 Culter (the short local name) has been part of Aberdeen city, but has so far retained its village character, and has active community organisations.
